detergent.name: Detergent Issues
detergent.description: Problems related to detergent dispensing, dissolving, or effectiveness

drainage.name: Drainage Problems
drainage.description: Issues with water draining from the washing machine

spinning.name: Spinning Issues
spinning.description: Problems with the spin cycle or drum rotation

electrical.name: Electrical Problems
electrical.description: Power, display, or electrical component issues

water.name: Water Issues
water.description: Problems with water filling, temperature, or pressure

detergent_not_dispensing.title: Detergent Not Dispensing Properly
detergent_not_dispensing.description: Washing machine is not dispensing detergent from the drawer during wash cycles

troubleshooting_steps.action: Remove and clean the detergent drawer
troubleshooting_steps.description: Pull out the detergent drawer completely and rinse with warm water. Use an old toothbrush to remove any buildup.
Ensure your home's water pressure is adequate. Try running other faucets to check pressure.
Wipe down the area where the drawer fits into the machine. Remove any soap residue or debris.
Reinstall the drawer properly and run a test cycle with detergent to verify it's dispensing.

prevention_tips: Use liquid detergent if powder keeps clogging

machine_not_draining.title: Water Not Draining from Machine
machine_not_draining.description: Water remains in the drum after the wash cycle completes

troubleshooting_steps.description: Ensure the drain hose is not kinked, twisted, or clogged. Check where it connects to the standpipe or sink.
Locate the drain pump filter (usually at bottom front). Place towels down, unscrew filter slowly, and clean out debris.
Remove any visible lint, coins, or small items from the filter housing.
Replace filter and run a drain/spin cycle to test if water drains properly.

prevention_tips: Check pockets for small items before washing

excessive_vibration.title: Excessive Vibration During Spin Cycle
excessive_vibration.description: Washing machine vibrates excessively or moves during the spin cycle

troubleshooting_steps.description: Stop the cycle and redistribute clothes evenly around the drum. Avoid washing single heavy items alone.
Use a spirit level to check if the machine is level. Adjust the feet as needed.
Ensure the machine is on a solid, level surface. Check that all four feet are firmly on the ground.
Run a cycle with a small, well-distributed load to see if vibration persists.

machine_wont_start.title: Machine Won't Start or Power On
machine_wont_start.description: Washing machine shows no signs of power or won't begin a cycle

troubleshooting_steps.description: Ensure the machine is plugged in securely. Check if the outlet is working by testing with another device.
Make sure the door is completely closed and latched. Clean the door seal if needed.
Verify that the circuit breaker hasn't tripped. Reset if necessary.
Attempt to start with a different wash cycle to see if it's a specific program issue.

loud_banging_noise.title: Loud Banging or Knocking Noise
loud_banging_noise.description: Machine makes loud banging or knocking sounds during operation
common_causes: Loose or foreign objects in drum

troubleshooting_steps.description: Turn off the machine and unplug it for safety. Do not continue operating.
Look inside the drum for loose items like coins, buttons, or small toys. Remove any found objects.
Gently rotate the drum by hand to check for unusual resistance or sounds.
Ensure the machine is properly leveled and all feet are stable.

water_not_filling.title: Water Not Filling Into Machine
water_not_filling.description: Machine starts but water doesn't enter the drum

troubleshooting_steps.description: Ensure both hot and cold water supply valves behind the machine are fully open.
Check that inlet hoses are not kinked, twisted, or damaged. Straighten if necessary.
Turn off water supply, disconnect hoses, and clean the small filters inside the inlet connections.
Before reconnecting, test water flow from the supply to ensure adequate pressure.

clothes_still_dirty.title: Clothes Not Getting Clean
clothes_still_dirty.description: Clothes come out of the wash cycle still dirty or with stains

troubleshooting_steps.description: Use the recommended amount of detergent for your load size and soil level. More isn't always better.
Wash smaller loads to allow clothes to move freely and get proper cleaning action.
Choose the correct wash cycle for your fabric type and soil level (heavy, normal, delicate).
Use warmer water for heavily soiled items (follow care labels). Ensure water heater is set to 120°F.

door_wont_open.title: Door Won't Open After Cycle
door_wont_open.description: Cannot open the washing machine door after the cycle has completed

troubleshooting_steps.description: Wait 2-3 minutes after cycle completion. The door lock may have a delay for safety.
If water is visible in the drum, run a drain/spin cycle to remove it.
Unplug the machine for 5 minutes, then plug back in to reset the door lock.
If available, use the emergency door release mechanism (usually behind the kick panel).

bad_odor.title: Bad Smell From Machine
bad_odor.description: Unpleasant odors coming from the washing machine

troubleshooting_steps.description: Wipe down the rubber door seal with a solution of water and white vinegar. Remove any visible mold.
Run a hot water cycle with 2 cups of white vinegar or washing machine cleaner.
Remove and thoroughly clean the detergent drawer with warm water and vinegar.
After cleaning, leave the door open for several hours to air dry completely.

water_temperature_wrong.title: Water Temperature Not Correct
water_temperature_wrong.description: Water temperature doesn't match the selected setting

troubleshooting_steps.description: Ensure your water heater is functioning properly and set to 120°F (49°C).
Check that hot and cold inlet hoses are connected to the correct valves (hot to hot, cold to cold).
Run hot water at a nearby faucet to ensure hot water is available to the machine.
Run a small load with hot water setting to test if temperature is now correct.

reset_machine.title: Reset the Machine
reset_machine.description: Unplug for 5 minutes, then plug back in

check_door_seal.title: Check Door Seal
check_door_seal.description: Clean rubber door seal and check for obstructions

balance_load.title: Balance the Load
balance_load.description: Redistribute clothes evenly in the drum

clean_filter.title: Clean Drain Filter
clean_filter.description: Remove and clean the drain pump filter
